title: Ana Kriégel's mum says her 'life has been destroyed' by the senseless murder of girl, 14
text:

The heartbroken mum of a schoolgirl who was murdered by two 14-year-old boys in an abandoned farmhouse said "our lives have been destroyed" by the killing.

The teenagers looked at Satanic' material and subjected Ana Kriégel to a senseless slaying, in which she suffered more than 60 horrific injuries.

They were convicted of murder and face sentencing today.

Ana's distraught mum Geraldine told of her grief in an emotional victim impact statement, read at the Central Criminal Court in Dublin today.

She said life without Ana “is no longer a life. It is a misery we must endure for the rest of our lives”.

The grief-stricken mum described her daughter as “the love of our lives” and said she was “wild, wonderful, electric”.

The girl was killed days after she was reported missing in May last year.

“We agonised for so many years through the adoption process waiting for her,” Geraldine Kriegel’s statement said.

“She brought us everything we dreamed of for all those years.”

“The happiest day of our lives was 10 August 2006, the day the court declared we could become Ana’s parents.”

(Image: Colin Keegan)

(Image: Colin Keegan)

She described the ‘panic, the dread, the agonising wait’ when Ana went missing in Lucan, Co Dublin.

“On Monday 14 May, Ana didn’t come home. The cold fear we felt knowing she was in danger. Something or someone prevented her coming home.”

“Hours turned into days. We didn’t know where she was or what happened to her, but somebody did. Somebody knew.”

“The saddest day of our lives was 17 May. Words no parents ever wants to hear: ‘We are so sorry’.”

“Our precious little girl’s body was found. There’s no way to describe how that feels.

(Image: Collins Photo Agency)

“Nobody could understand the evil laying in wait for her. How could any child imagine in their worst nightmares the danger that lay ahead? She wanted to live and she was not permitted to do that. Our lives have been destroyed.”

“Imagine the terror, the pain she endured,” she said. “That will live with us all our lives. We lie awake at night thinking about when she realised she was going to be killed, the horrendous and sadistic violation of her pure and innocent body.”

“To think she was left to rot for three days, it’s unbearable. It’s unhuman.”

The hearing continues in Dublin.

The boys will be sentenced either later this afternoon or at a later date.
description: Ana Kriégel was murdered by two 14-year-old boys in Lucan, Co Dublin
